ðŸŒŸ hummingbot | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Design and deploy automated trading bots on various exchanges
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Open-source framework for automated trading strategies â€¢ Connectors to centralized (CEX) and decentralized (DEX) exchanges â€¢ Support for various market types: CLOB Spot, CLOB Perp, AMM â€¢ REST and WebSocket API interfaces
ðŸ“– Summary: Hummingbot is an open-source framework enabling the creation and deployment of automated trading bots across multiple centralized and decentralized exchanges. It offers standardized connectors for different market types (CLOB Spot, CLOB Perp, AMM) using REST and WebSocket APIs. The framework allows users to build sophisticated trading strategies deployable across many exchanges with minimal changes.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ llama-stack | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Simplifying AI application development by standardizing core building blocks and providing a consistent API across different environments and providers
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Unified API layer for Inference, RAG, Agents, Tools, Safety, Evals, and Telemetry â€¢ Plugin architecture to support various API implementations â€¢ Prepackaged verified distributions for quick and reliable setup â€¢ Multiple developer interfaces (CLI, Python, Typescript, iOS, Android SDKs) â€¢ Standalone applications as examples for building AI applications
ðŸ“– Summary: Llama Stack offers a unified API and plugin architecture for building AI applications, supporting various environments (local, cloud, mobile). It provides prepackaged distributions and multiple developer interfaces to streamline development and deployment. The project includes standalone applications demonstrating production-grade AI application building.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ OpenPDF | Java
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating and editing PDF files
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Creating PDFs â€¢ Manipulating Existing PDFs â€¢ Text and Font Support â€¢ Graphics and Images â€¢ Table Support
ðŸ“– Summary: OpenPDF is a Java library for creating and editing PDF documents. It supports various features including text and font manipulation, image and graphic inclusion, table creation, encryption, and page layout customization. This library allows users to generate new PDFs from scratch or modify existing ones.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ rclone | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Synchronizing files and directories to and from various cloud storage providers.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Command-line program â€¢ Syncs files and directories â€¢ Supports various cloud storage providers â€¢ rsync-like functionality
ðŸ“– Summary: Rclone is a command-line program that acts like "rsync for cloud storage," enabling users to synchronize files and directories between various cloud storage providers and local systems. It supports a wide array of cloud services and offers a robust feature set for managing cloud storage efficiently.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ novus | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Managing multiple localhost services using real domain names instead of ports
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Uses Nginx as a reverse proxy â€¢ Uses DNSMasq for custom domain resolution â€¢ Automatically manages and renews SSL certificates using mkcert â€¢ Allows mapping localhost URLs to custom domains â€¢ Provides command-line interface for managing services
ðŸ“– Summary: Novus simplifies local development by using Nginx and DNSMasq to manage multiple localhost services with custom domains and automatic SSL certificates. It offers a command-line interface for easy configuration and management of these services, eliminating the need to manually edit /etc/hosts or remember complex port numbers.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ wild | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Faster build times during development of Rust code on x86-64 Linux systems
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Fast linking for iterative development (though not yet incremental) â€¢ Supports x86-64 Linux â€¢ Outputs statically linked, non-relocatable binaries â€¢ Outputs statically linked, position-independent binaries (static-PIE) â€¢ Outputs to dynamically linked binaries
ðŸ“– Summary: Wild is a linker aiming for speed during iterative development, especially beneficial for Rust projects on x86-64 Linux. It currently supports various output types and features, although incremental linking and broader platform support are planned for the future. For production, more mature linkers are recommended.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ lume | Swift
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating, running, and managing macOS and Linux virtual machines on Apple Silicon with high performance.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Lightweight CLI and local API server for managing macOS and Linux VMs â€¢ Near-native performance on Apple Silicon using Apple's Virtualization.Framework â€¢ Create, run, manage, and delete VMs â€¢ Pull pre-built macOS images â€¢ VM configuration modification (CPU, memory, disk size, resolution)
ðŸ“– Summary: Lume is a command-line interface and API server that leverages Apple's Virtualization.Framework to provide efficient macOS and Linux VM management on Apple Silicon. It offers features such as creating, running, configuring, and deleting VMs, along with the ability to pull pre-built images and interact programmatically via its API server.
